overview:
## Return Value

A publisher that handles errors from an upstream publisher by replacing the failed publisher with another publisher, or an error.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/tryCatch(_:)] to decide how to handle from an upstream publisher by either replacing the publisher with a new publisher, or throwing a new error.

In the example below, an array publisher emits values that a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/tryMap(_:)] operator evaluates to ensure the values are greater than zero. If the values aren’t greater than zero, the operator throws an error to the downstream subscriber to let it know there was a problem. The subscriber, [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/tryCatch(_:)], replaces the error with a new publisher using [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Just] to publish a final value before the stream ends normally.
